intro: Fothergilla major, commonly known as smooth fringecup, is a deciduous shrub native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its showy, fragrant, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has opposite, simple, and often hairy leaves that turn yellow in the fall. It prefers moist, well-drained soils and partial to full sun. Fothergilla major is valued in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
